intro: Decaneuropsis obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen, obovate leaves that are typically leathery and dark green. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Decaneuropsis obovata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
